title: Found Type Image Request
content:
Well, I am looking for three images. Preferably of high quality and resolution. I need an image for the letter O, V, and a different type of O. _(This will be hard to guess what I am using this one for ;)_

I know a lot of you snap up digital images of this type of thing. Would anyone be willing to share? _(I will disclose usage with you privately)_
author: Hildebrant

comments.content: Do you mean signage including these letters?

I do shoot type, but nearly always in context; so I’d be hard pressed to provide you with high-res close-ups of letters. Might be a good idea to render lowres photographs into vector-format, to loose the highres-problem.

——————————————————————————  
My work is a game. A very serious game [M.C. Escher]
Thanks, Stephen. I will browse these.

Found letterforms as either type or objects was also one of the running themes in the ancient but never forgotten _U&lc_.

Also of interest are Clotilde Olyff’s [pebble alphabets](http://web.archive.org/web/20051128104037/http:/www.dorpdal.com/lettered/pebble1.html) (as brought to Typophile’s attention by Monsieur David Berlow).
